nodes.text: Marie Severin (August 21, 1929 – August 30, 2018) was a comic book artist who worked as a penciller, inker, and colorist. She contributed to a few issues of the Marvel Star Wars series as well as issues of Droids and Ewoks.

She began working in comics at EC Comics in the 1950s and by 1959 had started working for Marvel Comics where she contributed to numerous titles over several decades including The Incredible Hulk and Kull the Conqueror. She was also the co-creator of the character Jessica Drew/Spider-Woman.
